description: An adaptation of Latin dissēmināt-, the perfect passive participial stem of dissēminō (“I broadcast”, “I disseminate”), from dis- (“in all directions”) + sēminō (“I plant”, “I sow”), from sēmen (“seed”).

verbs.description: disseminate (third-person singular simple present disseminates, present participle disseminating, simple past and past participle disseminated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To sow and scatter principles, ideas, opinions, etc, or concrete things, for growth and propagation, like seeds.

examples: The values of the human rights movement have disseminated throughout the world.
